spanishExample: ¡Basta! ¡Hable con él antes del fin del día!
englishTranslation: Enough! (formal) Talk to him before the end of the day!
vocabIncluded: del: "of the" before a masculine noun

spanishExample: ¡Claro! Ese es mi punto.
englishTranslation: Of course! That’s my point.

spanishExample: ¡Dale! Siempre hablas de cosas buenas.
englishTranslation: Go ahead! You always speak about good things.
vocabIncluded: de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
hablas: speak, you speak (Hablar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: ¡Habla ahora y dile que no hablamos ayer!
englishTranslation: Speak now and tell him we didn’t speak yesterday!
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
hablamos: spoke, we spoke (Hablar, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: ¡Hey! Tenemos unas cuantas personas aquí.
englishTranslation: Hey! We have a small number of people here.

spanishExample: ¡Lo tendremos para el fin de la fiesta!
englishTranslation: We'll have it by the end of the party!
vocabIncluded: "para": "by" a moment in time, as in "by then"
tendremos: "will have", "we will have" (Tener, future, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: ¡No he hablado con ellos de la muerte aún!
englishTranslation: I haven’t talked to them about death yet!
vocabIncluded: de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
he: "have", "I have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: ¡Pasa! ¿Qué tal, estás bien?
englishTranslation: Come in! What’s up, are you well?
vocabIncluded: "bien": adverb meaning "well", "fine", and a variety of other positive things

spanishExample: ¡Perdón! Tenemos que estar aquí hasta el final.
englishTranslation: Sorry! We have to be here until the ending.
vocabIncluded: using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: ¡Por fin! Estuve aquí por un par de horas.
englishTranslation: Finally! I was here for a couple of hours.

spanishExample: ¡Por fin! No queremos que hables más.
englishTranslation: Finally! We don’t want you to talk anymore.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
hables: speak, you speak (Hablar, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: ¿Con cuántas personas hablarás?
englishTranslation: With how many people will you talk?
vocabIncluded: hablarás: will speak, you will speak (Hablar, future, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Ah, no hablará con él y no dirá adiós.
englishTranslation: Ah, she won’t talk to him and won’t say goodbye.
vocabIncluded: dirá: "will say", "he/she/it will say" (Decir, future, 3rd person)
hablará: will speak, he/she/it will speak (Hablar, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Al final, la muerte es una parte de la vida.
englishTranslation: In the end, death is a part of life.

spanishExample: Ay, pasamos tiempo con ellos aquí.
englishTranslation: Yikes, we’re spending time with them here.
vocabIncluded: pasamos: pass, we pass (Pasar, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Bueno, al final ella no puso sus cosas ahí.
englishTranslation: All right, in the end she didn’t put her things there.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
puso: put, he/she/it put (Poner, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Cuanto más hablo, más hablan.
englishTranslation: The more I talk, the more they talk.
vocabIncluded: hablan: speak, they speak (Hablar, present, 3rd person plural)
hablo: speak, I speak (Hablar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Cuanto menos tiempo ella pase con esta persona, mejor.
englishTranslation: The less time she spends with this person, the better.
vocabIncluded: pase: pass, he/she/it pass (Pasar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Eh, estamos hablando, pero en fin, ¿qué pasa?
englishTranslation: Hmm, we’re talking, but anyway, what’s happening?
vocabIncluded: en fin: “anyway” / “in a nutshell” / “all in all” (idiom)
pasa: passes, he/she/it passes (Pasar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: En fin, cuando pase tiempo contigo será en el medio del día.
englishTranslation: Anyway, when I spend time with you it’ll be in the middle of the day.
vocabIncluded: del: "of the" before a masculine noun
en fin: “anyway” / “in a nutshell” / “all in all” (idiom)
pase: pass, I pass (Pasar, subjunctive, 1st person)
será: "will be", "he/she/it will be" (Ser, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Hablaba con un par de personas.
englishTranslation: I was talking to a couple of people.
vocabIncluded: hablaba: was speaking, I was speaking (Hablar, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: Hablamos y ella me da su número.
englishTranslation: We’re talking and she gives me her number.
vocabIncluded: hablamos: speak, we speak (Hablar, present, 1st person plural)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")

spanishExample: No podemos hablar en el medio de esto.
englishTranslation: We can’t talk in the middle of this.
vocabIncluded: hablar: to speak / to talk (Hablar infinitive)

spanishExample: No vio el final.
englishTranslation: He didn’t see the ending.
vocabIncluded: vio: saw, he/she/it saw (Ver, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Oh, no pasé la clase por un punto.
englishTranslation: Oh, I didn’t pass the class because of one point.
vocabIncluded: pasé: passed, I passed (Pasar, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: Okey, pasará cuanto tiempo quiera ahí.
englishTranslation: Okay, she will pass as much time as she wants there.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
cuanto: "as much" or "as much as" (indefinite adjective)
pasará: will pass, he/she/it will pass (Pasar, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Pues, hablaré con él y él me dará su número.
englishTranslation: Well, I will talk to him and he’ll give me his number.
vocabIncluded: dará: "will give", "he/she/it will give" (Dar, future, 3rd person)
hablaré: will speak, I will speak (Hablar, future, 1st person)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")

spanishExample: Si habla, puede hacerlo cuanto quiera.
englishTranslation: If she talks, she can do it as much as she wants.
vocabIncluded: cuanto used with a subjunctive to mean "as much as", as in “cuanto quiera” (pronoun)
habla: speaks, he/she/it speaks (Hablar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Sí, ¡vete! ¡Nos vemos!
englishTranslation: Yes, leave! See ya!

spanishExample: Siempre paso mis clases.
englishTranslation: I always pass my classes.
vocabIncluded: paso: pass, I pass (Pasar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Yo no hablé. Tú hablaste.
englishTranslation: I didn’t talk. You talked.
vocabIncluded: hablaste: spoke, you spoke (Hablar, preterite, 2nd person)
hablé: spoke, I spoke (Hablar, preterite, 1st person)
